channel.description: [url='https://games.slashdot.org/story/09/12/18/1649253/Microsoft-Seeks-Patent-On-Shaming-Fat-Gamers']Mircosoft Seeks Patent On Shaming Fat Gamers[/url] Got this from another Forum, but it gave me a few giggles and so I thought I'd share it with you all here. Basically the idea is your Avatar will reflect what your medical records say about you, so if you're overweight, it will affect the apperance of your avatar and even ban you from entering certain competitions on Xbox Live. Looks like we won't even be able to escape our real lives anymore :frowning:

item.title: Microsoft VS. The Fatties
item.dc:creator: chumchum
item.description:
Though this discussion seems to be cross at the descriminating aspect of this patent, I find the gross violation of users privacy through acces of health records far more disturbing.

How certain are you of this article’s, I can’t imagine any private enterprise having access to such information, especially for multinational services that would need to deel with privacy laws from all around the glode.
So wouldn’t the weight be entered by the player, meaning it’s not so much descrimination, but just relies on what they want to type in?

Also in regard to what some people have answered me;
-Drunkards and drug addicts are just as much of a problem, probably worse, yes, and prevention is important.
-In reply to Doom, there’s not much one can do themselves about heart failure for instance, and unfortunately the sheer amount of obese people here (I live in the UK, way fatter than the NL) shows that some are unwilling to do much about it regardless of the effects, much like persistent smokers.
Similarly to smoking I think people should be as free as possible, but their rights musn’t tread on those of others, " Liberty consists in the freedom to do everything which injures no one else". It is fine if someone is willing to be fat, it is their body, but this might disrupt others, examples can range from petty, such as fat people forcing elders to stand on the bus, because their arse takes up two seats, to more worrying such as diverting vital hospital funds on larger equipement.

Considering my last point, I condemn this idea, because it seems to discriminate and violate privacy should it be mandatory in order to use an other service.

What ever idiots decided to do this, obviously did not speak to the PR department in Microsoft.

people need incentives when they don’t understand how sick they are

Being obese (fat is not necessarily obese) is a sickness and not healthy.
Thats what body mass index is for.

chumchum:

Fat people are a terrible burden on the NHS, the national health’s deficit is bad enough without have to spend arseloads on the associated effects of obesity.
Why should money be taken away from more needing sick patients for people who’ve brought this upon themselves by gluttony and laziness.
Of course a great many obese people are so without any fault of their own, and I believe they need help.
I’m not saying we should let them die, but that everything must be done prevent it, the state can help in doing this with their nanny state awareness programs, so I see any other incentives to lose weight as a good thing.

If healthcare is done well then obese people don’t have to be a problem at all, also, people who actually get health problems from being overweight will most of the time do something about it themselves. People don’t WANT to get sick.

I believe anyone should be able to be as fat or thin as he or she wants, health effects are their own concern. And no-one has to provide any “incentives” for this, people are already getting enough bullshit about watching their weight from the common media.

Why would Microsoft want those details from a gamer? To make avatars more realistic? Bullshit. Maybe they’re compiling a huge database of everyone so when the time comes they can active the mind control chips…
